feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Master Data Governance
feed.subtitle: SAP Master Data Governance Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Custom attribute is not showing at Change request step level in configure properties of CR step.
entry.content:
Hello team,
In SAP MDG, I extended the data model by introducing custom attributes to the MARCBASIC entity type. While the attributes are correctly defined in the data model (checked via the Data Model Repository), they are not displayed during processing at Change Request Step 00 for the relevant Change Request type in configuration of change request step in MDGIMG config.

entry.title: How to add F4 value to Custom Field in MM01 Tcode
entry.content:
Hi Team,
I have created a custom tab with some custom fields at the material master (S4 level) in transaction MM01. These fields have been appended at the MARA table level using Custom Fields & Logic (CFL) fiori app, which currently prevents me from adding a search help directly at the database level with message ( You cannot edit object R3TR TABL ** with the standard editor) .We also do not require the use of a CDS view for this enhancement.
Is there an alternative way to enable search help for these custom fields, or could someone advise if there is a user exit or another place where we could implement custom logic for this purpose?
Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: MDG Mass creation of Key Mappings in the S4 HANA System
entry.content:
Hi Every One,

Our requirement is to insert Key Mappings for MDG BP.

I found a Program CREATE_MASS_KEY_MAPPING, but its deprecated in S4 System. 

Another way is the Transaction MDG_KM_MAINTAIN, but this i can not use for Mas creation.

Please let us know if any standard Program to create Key Mapping for MDG BP. After creation where we can check these key Mappings.

Thanks & Regards,

Prasad.

entry.title: MDG-M Get others Node Data from a different Node
entry.content:
Hi, Experts.

I added a custom field within the Basic Data section in the Manage Material - governance app (entity MATERIAL node MARA). I also created a feeder class (subclass of CL_MDG_BS_MAT_FEEDER_FORM) to personalize the search help of this new field.

All ok so far. The problem is that I need to get the data from a different node (MAKT) to know what information should be shown in the search help. I do not know how to get the data from a node (MAKT) different than the node (MARA) of my new field. I tried instantiating class /PLMU/CL_FRW_CONTEXT_POOL, but the attribute that contains the information (MT_CONTEXT_POOL) is private and I cannot read it from the feeder class. üòû 

I'm trying to do this in the method /PLMU/IF_FRW_G_OVS~HANDLE_PHASE_2.

Any advice? thanks in advance.

entry.title: MDG-M Get data of a node from other node. Manage Material - Governance App
entry.content:
Hi Experts.

I'm dealing with getting the data of node MAKT and entity MATERIAL from the feeder class associated to a search help of a new field that belongs to a different node (MARA). My feeder class is a subclass of CL_MDG_BS_MAT_FEEDER_FORM.

Within method /PLMU/IF_FRW_G_OVS~HANDLE_PHASE_2, I tried to instantiate class /PLMU/CL_FRW_CONTEXT_POOL and get the MAKT context from the attribute MT_CONTEXT_POOL, however, this is private and I cannot read it from my code.

Any advice? Thanks in advance.

entry.title: How do you know the vendor number in MDG and its corresponding vendor number in S4HANA?
entry.content:
Hi MDG Experts,

May I know how do you check the mapping of a vendor in SAP MDG (source) versus its vendor code in SAP S4HANA (target)? Is there a configuration or SAP standard table that is being maintained?

If yes, please provide the path in IMG or the SAP standard table?

Thanks,

Newguycloud

entry.title: MDG Consolidation process to trigger from Mulesoft
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Can you advise me of the steps as to how I can trigger a Consolidation process from a message coming from Mulesoft(Salesforce)? We have a requirement where we need to trigger Consolidation likewise.

Any help explaining all the detailed steps would be much appreciated.

Thanks, T

entry.title: Differentiating QM processes for in-house vs. external procurement under Procurement Type ‚ÄúX‚Äù
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

We are working on an SAP project for a client who wants to use Procurement Type ‚ÄúX‚Äù (both in-house and external procurement) for certain semi-finished and assembly materials.

From the QM side, the client wants to ensure clear differentiation of quality management processes depending on whether the material is produced internally or procured externally.

We are currently analyzing how this can be configured and controlled within SAP ERP.
Some of the main questions we have are:

  1. QM differentiation:

    • How can QM responsibilities, inspection lots, and first article inspections (FAI) be managed separately for in-house vs. externally sourced lots when Procurement Type = ‚ÄúX‚Äù?

    • Are there standard configuration options (e.g., inspection types, source-specific QM data, site-specific fields, or custom enhancements) that allow this distinction?

  2. Governance and master data:

    • If Procurement Type ‚ÄúX‚Äù is used, what governance mechanisms or procedures do you apply to ensure that QM and SCM responsibilities are clearly separated and audit-compliant?

    • Are there cases where separate material numbers are still recommended for QM control reasons?

Any real-world examples, best-practice setups, or configuration hints from projects where Procurement Type ‚ÄúX‚Äù was implemented successfully would be extremely valuable for our analysis.

Thank you very much in advance for your insights!

Best regards,

entry.title: UI Configuration of screen behavior in 'Create new' screen in FIORI
entry.content:
Hi experts,
I am working on a modification of a screen in FIORI which is actually to change the behavior to work same as any CR Types - "Create new material"(Material Data Management).
Coming to the point, for a standard CR types - create new screen then filling mandatory field and then directly if we click on 'cancel button' it gives a pop up waring-> OK and then navigates to another screen(non-editable screen), further we get 'continue' button. And when it is clicked it takes back to "Create new screen again".
But incase some of our ZM CR types(Manage Front number, Manage Middle group, Mange description catalogue ) it works same till cancel button but after clicking on cancel button it navigates to a different screen(editable screen) without a "Continue button".
I am trying to know how can we change the screen behavior so that it will work same as like in "Create new material" standard process, or where can I check to compare this difference and replicate the same in our ZM CR-types scenario.
I have attached two screenshots to compare both above mentioned scenarios.
Best Regards,
Sagar

entry.title: SAP MDG Upgrade: After upgrade standard UIBB ERP vendor not visible
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have upgraded our mdg system fps 1909 to 2023. after upgrade the standard UIBBs like ERP vendor and ERP customer are not visible while maintaining the data using CR in fiori. we did not enhance these UIBBs with any custom fields. We have two custom handler classes but they are related to different UIBBs not related to ERP vendor or customer.

please let me know the root cause of this problem.

Thanks, Srikanth

entry.title: MDG 2023 Upgrade Business Function Activation
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have upgraded MDG from 2021 to 2023 and after upgrade we completed SPDD and later when we started to adjust SPAU objects we have identified the Business Functions was not activated to the latest version of 2023.

Now can we complete the SPAU objects without activating the Business Functions and later can we activate.

Will there be any impact.

Regards,

SP

entry.title: how can i read the MLANSALES entity data in derivation class?
entry.content:
Dear Colleagues

I worked on deriving default sales orgs for a POOL material .

Sales org derived(Distribution Chains) and also the relevant tax classification(Standard) in Distribution Chain: Tax .

I also want to default the tax classification but  i am not able to read the tax classification data.

Entity is MLANSALES , it is not having any attributes but having relationships.

So, how could i read the MLANSALES entity?

 

regards

Chandra.

entry.title: Key Mapping in SAP MDG
entry.content:
SAP Master Data Governance 

the management of different number ranges for different target systems in an SAP MDG Hub Deployment is a standard requirement and is primarily achieved using the System-Specific Number Range Definition and the Key Mapping functionality.

The goal is to allow the MDG Hub to create a master data record (e.g., Business Partner/Customer/Supplier) with its own number, while the target systems receive a different, local number upon replication.

Here is the standard Configuration :

 MDG Hub Numbering vs. Target System Numbering

In an MDG Hub deployment, the MDG system assigns the Central Governance ID (the unique master data key) for the record. For replication to a target system with a different number range,

 

  1. MDG Hub: Typically use Internal Number Assignment for the Business Partner (BP) in the MDG system itself. The BP number range is configured in the Hub using transaction SNRO for the object BU_PARTNER.
  2. Target ERP System: The corresponding number range for the Customer/Vendor/Material in the target system must be configured for External Number Assignment. This allows the target system to accept the different number that will be derived during replication.

 

 Configuration for Target System Number Ranges

SAP MDG provides specific Customizing activities to define the number range that should be used by the target system for a replicated record, based on its Account Group or Material Type.

Go the  transaction MDGIMG

 (or SPRO under Master Data Governance ‚Üí Central Governance ‚Üí [MDG for Business Partner / Customer / Supplier]).

  1. Number Range Derivation per Target System

This configuration allows you to override the standard number that would be derived in the target system.

  • For Customer/Supplier: Use the Customizing activity:
    • Define Number Ranges for [Customer/Supplier] Account Groups per Target System.
    • In this table, you map the Account Group (or Customer/Supplier Account Group) to the Target System (or Logical System) and assign a specific Number Range Key (Group) that the target system must use for that combination.
  1. Replication of the New Number

When the approved Change Request is replicated using the Data Replication Framework (DRF):

  • The replication service reads the configuration defined in Step A.
  • It determines the correct Target System Number Range (Group) based on the target system and the account group of the master data object.
  • The target system's number logic will then apply the external number assignment logic using that configured group/range key.

 

Key Mapping for Synchronization

Key Mapping is essential to ensure that the unique MDG Hub number is correctly linked to the unique number in each target system.

  • Purpose: The Key Mapping Table stores the relationship between the MDG ID and the corresponding local ID in all connected target systems.
  • Configuration: Key Mapping is configured under MDGIMG ‚Üí General Settings ‚Üí Key Mapping ‚Üí Define Key Mapping (or transaction IDMIMG).
  • Usage:
    • When the record is replicated to Target System A, the local number A is generated and stored in the Key Mapping table alongside the MDG Hub ID.
    • When the record is replicated to Target System B, the local number B is generated (based on its number range) and also stored in the Key Mapping table, linked to the same MDG Hub ID.

This ensures that the MDG system can always look up the correct local number to use for updates or lookups in any specific target system.

entry.title: MDG Supplier ‚Äì WS54300005 BRF+ DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1
entry.content:
Bonjour √† tous,

Je configure SAP MDG pour les fournisseurs sur S/4HANA et je suis bloqu√© avec le flux de travail bas√© sur des r√®gles pour le type de demande de modification SUPPL1P1 (Cr√©er un fournisseur).

Le mod√®le de flux de travail est WS54300005 (MDG : Cr√©er un fournisseur) et l'application BRF+ est USMD_SSW_CATA_SUPPL1P1 .

1. Ce que j'ai configur√©

  1. Type de demande de modification

    • Type de CR : SUPPL1P1

    • Les types d'entit√©s, leur p√©rim√®tre et leurs activit√©s commerciales sont g√©r√©s dans SPRO :

      • Types d'entit√©s : BP_HEADER, BP_REL, ADDRNO

      • Activit√© commerciale : SUP1 ‚Äì Cr√©er un fournisseur

    • L'accord de niveau de service et les autres param√®tres CR sont conserv√©s.

  2. D√©termination du flux de travail/agent

    • Le flux de travail bas√© sur des r√®gles est activ√© pour SUPPL1P1.

    • Le mod√®le de flux de travail WS54300005 est attribu√©.

    • Dans la transaction PFTC , j'ai d√©fini les t√¢ches MDG concern√©es sur ¬´ T√¢che g√©n√©rale ¬ª .

  3. BRF+ (Application USMD_SSW_CATA_SUPPL1P1)

    Dans la section Tableaux de d√©cision, j'ai :

    • DT_USER_AGT_GRP_SUPPL1P1 (Table de d√©cision de l'agent utilisateur)

      • Plusieurs lignes avec Condition Alias =1‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã, =3,=5

      • Num√©ro de groupe d'agent utilisateur =001

      • Type d'√©tape = 2(Approuver la demande de modification), 4(R√©viser), 5(Activer)

      • Type d'agent utilisateur =US (User)

      • Valeur de l'agent utilisateur = mon utilisateur SKATYS_ILYS

    • DT_NON_USER_AGT_GRP_SUPPL1P1 (Groupe d'agents non-utilisateurs)

      • Alias =2‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã, =4, =6, =8, =9pour les √©tapes techniques (activation / ach√®vement / restauration, etc.)

      • Tous avec le groupe d'agents = 001.

    • DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 (Tableau de d√©cision √† valeur unique)
      Au d√©part, ce tableau √©tait vide et la fonction Check a g√©n√©r√© les erreurs suivantes :

      • DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 (Expression) : Entr√©e requise dans la colonne 'DemModif.√©tape pr√©c.' (PREVIOUS_STEP) manquante.

      • Contr√¥les de domaine pour CR_REASON (USMD211C) et CR_REASON_REJ (USMD212C) .

      J'ai ensuite ajout√© des lignes.
      Voici le contenu actuel (simplifi√©) :

      √âtape pr√©c√©dente de la demande de modification : Action pr√©c√©dente : Priorit√© de la demande de modification : Raison de la demande de modification : Raison du rejet de la CR : Alias ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãde la condition : Nouvelle √©tape de la demande de modification
      =00‚Ä¶ (vid√©o)‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶190
      =90=04 (Rejeter)‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶395

      Le tableau est enregistr√©, v√©rifi√© et activ√© . L'application et l'ensemble de r√®gles sont √©galement actifs (statut vert).

2. Sympt√¥me

Lorsque je cr√©e une demande de modification fournisseur ( application Fiori ‚Äì ¬´ Traitement de la demande de modification ¬ª / Process Supplier Change Requests ) :

  • La demande de changement (CR) a √©t√© cr√©√©e correctement avec le statut ¬´ Flux de travail en cours ¬ª .

  • Dans la bo√Æte de r√©ception MDG (Fiori Ma bo√Æte de r√©ception), je ne re√ßois aucun √©l√©ment de travail √† approuver .

  • Dans la transaction SWI1 , je ne vois que le sous-workflow WS54300005 avec le statut Erreur et aucun √©l√©ment de travail de dialogue.

Captures d'√©cran (en pi√®ce jointe) :

  1. La demande de modification indique ¬´ Workflow en cours de traitement ¬ª.

  2. SWI1 ‚Äì uniquement WS54300005 avec statut Erreur.

  3. Journal de flux de travail :

    • Les √©tapes ¬´ D√©finir le statut 1 pour la demande de changement ¬ª, ¬´ V√©rifier la demande de changement ¬ª et ¬´ Obtenir le filtre d'agent ¬ª sont termin√©es .

    • Il n'y a pas d'√©tape ¬´ Approuver la demande de modification‚Ä¶ ¬ª et le flux de travail se termine imm√©diatement.

  4. Affichage ¬´ Agents de workflow ¬ª : je vois SAP_WFRT et mon utilisateur SKATYS_ILYS uniquement pour l'√©v√©nement de d√©marrage.

Le filtre de l'agent BRF+ est donc ex√©cut√© , mais il semble qu'aucune ligne de DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 ne corresponde , par cons√©quent aucune √©tape utilisateur n'est cr√©√©e.

‚ÄÉ

entry.title: BP Data Model Extension - FPM List UIBB is not working on the Customer Creation Screen
entry.content:
Hi,

1. We have created custom Type 4 Entity under BP_HEADER Node. we need store this data in the standard Table UKMBP_CMS_SGM.

2. Added List UIBB to the screen, placed Edit and New Buttons on the screen. Used Custom Feeder Class which extends CL_BS_BP_GUIBB_LIST.

3. Genil Enhancement created with Custom Genil class which extends CL_BS_GENIL_CUSTOMER.

Issue: We are getting the Table on the screen,

New Button - is visible but not working.

Edit Button - Not visible at all.

Thanks,

Prasad.

entry.title: How to Submit MDG CR with auto approval for multiple customers in odata request
entry.content:
Requirement is to find the customers using VAT number (received using Odata service) and update field attribute 10 with hardcoded value. The CR will get auto approved.

There is an already existing CR for customer change which has got approval process associated with it.
How to achieve the requirement without hampering the existing process.
Please note sender system can send only the VAT number.

entry.title: MDG Materials Duplicate Check
entry.content:
Hello experts,

we have configured duplicate check in MDG-M on Material description (medium). It works fine, but sometimes there is a strange behavouir on the duplicate check.

The duplicate check pops up, even though there is no duplicate.

Does anybody knows this issue or knows how to resolve?

We have followed approach as per standard setup also referred to the blog:

How to add custom generic fields for Ariba SLP to ... - SAP Community

Please share your valuable experience.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Errors during the Mass Creation of Business Partner Relationships
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
we have the following issue during the migration of 2000 Business Partner relationships.
We are using the app  "Manage Mass Creation Processes - BP Relationships (F6560A)" to import BP-Relationships for existing Business Partners.
We split the import into batches of 500, but if we try to activate these, then the system activates 100 of those and then gives the following error:
"User SAP_WFRT is processing the business partners relationship XY"
The error counter varies, if you reprocess the activation, sometimes it goes up one or two, then it drops down, till it activates another 100 entries. Eventually it activates all 500, so we were able to import the first batch. All of this takes a lot of time.

Our question is, is this standard behavior ? Can the tool only import 100 relationships at once and then needs time to process some stuff in the background ? 

We appreciate and advice on how to improve this process.
Best regards
Lukas
